title: Activate registered user
name: ActivateUser
description: Attempts to activate the user, and, if successful, returns authentication token and activated user info

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
curl -i -X POST -H 'Accept-Version: *' -H 'Accept: application/vnd.api+json' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' \
  "https://api-users.sandbox.matic.ninja/api/users/activate?token=xxx"

Code 200.description: jsonwebtoken to be used for further authentication

examples.title: Success-User:
ValidationError:

name: BanUser
description: Locks or unlocks account of the specified user based on the body payload

examples.title: Authorization-Example:

Body.description: we are modifying this object type, must be 'user'

title: Get user object
name: GetUser
description: Returns user object and it's metadata by user'd id

examples.title: Authorization-Example:
examples.content: "Authorization: JWT myreallyniceandvalidjsonwebtoken"

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
curl -i -H 'Accept-Version: *' -H 'Accept: application/vnd.api+json' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' \
  -H 'Content-Type: applicaion/vnd.api+json' -H "Authorization: JWT realjwttoken" \
  "https://api-users.sandbox.matic.ninja/api/users/v%40example.com"

examples.title: Success-User:

title: List user objects
name: GetUserObjects
description: Returns list of user objects, allows filtering by multiple metadata fields, sorting by a single field in ASC/DESC fashion and paginating over them

examples.title: Authorization-Example:
examples.content: "Authorization: JWT myreallyniceandvalidjsonwebtoken"

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
curl -i -H 'Accept-Version: *' -H 'Accept: application/vnd.api+json' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' \
  -H 'Content-Type: applicaion/vnd.api+json' -H "Authorization: JWT realjwttoken" \
  "https://api-users.sandbox.matic.ninja/api/users"

Query.description: how many users to return per page
encodeURIComponent(JSON.stringify(filterObject)), pass it as value. # - filters by username, other keys - by allowed metadata
encodeURIComponent(sortBy), if not specified, sorts by username, otherwise by metadata field passed here

Code 200.description: set as offset for the next page

examples.title: Success-User:

title: Registers new user
name: Register
description: Registers user in the system and send email validation request, so that the user can activate the account

Body.description: make sure that user typed in the same password

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
curl -i -X POST -H 'Accept-Version: *' -H 'Accept: application/vnd.api+json' \
  -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' \
  -H 'Content-Type: applicaion/vnd.api+json' \
  "https://api-users.sandbox.matic.ninja/api/users" \
  -d '{
    "data": {
      "type": "user",
      "id": "v@example.com",
      "attributes": {
        "password": "somerealpassword",
        "passwordRepeat": "somerealpassword",
        "firstName": "Vitaly",
        "lastName": "Nordstrom",
        "companyName": "LasVatos, LLC",
        "country": "USA",
        "city": "Las Vegas",
        "gender": "male",
        "birthday": "1934.09.25",
        "phone": "(440)0000000"
      }
    }
  }'

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content: HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted

examples.title: ValidationError:
PreconditionFailedError:
ForbiddenResponse:
PreconditionFailedError:

title: Updates user's data
name: UpdateMetadata
description: Updates user's associated data, if user is an admin - he/she can change this data for any of the existing users. However, ordinary user can only change the data for her/himself. For that case :id param my equal me

examples.title: Authorization-Example:
examples.content: "Authorization: JWT myreallyniceandvalidjsonwebtoken"

Params.description: username, for ordinary user must be me. Admin can use any applicable username here

Body.description: fields that should be removed from metadata
